data: As the Capital Express train dashed into the village of Bruceton one bright afternoon, a brakeman passing through a car was touched on the shoulder by a man, who said, “The man that left this in the seat in front got out three stations back. You don’t s’pose he’ll want it again an' send back for it, do you?”
browsing: literature|browsing: religion/spirituality/paranormal|browsing: fiction|category: novels|category: american literature
